channel.title: Worth buying membership for?
channel.description: Without judging RS based on its previous revisions, is it worth paying the monthly fee for? Is the community still garbage? I kind of want to see if it's worth checking out and getting back into, but I don't feel like joining and then finding out the community does not exist, bots have infested everything, and the game just has a lack of enjoyment when playing.

item.title: Worth buying membership for?
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

I buy membership for 07rs lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Worth buying membership for?
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:7, topic:531774”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=650559.msg4367429#msg4367429 date=1379946840]

I don’t do a lot of combat if I can help it so I can’t speak for that but at least in the general city areas I don’t honestly see a lot of botting these days.

I’d say go for it.

Thanks, I’ll have to look into it more now. Is combat boring or something? I mean all of the skills are kind of a grind but I know they added a bunch of ways to skill now so it seems easier/less monotonous for at least some skills. I haven’t really played since the release of EoC so I am not really used to anything but like FM, which I am at like 98 lol
[/quote]EOC combat “can” be fun you just have to get used to it and on a daily routine if that makes sense.

It is a lot less boring than the old combat system imo. You actually have to pay attention and use the abilities that are available to you based on what combat style you’re using and what type of weapon you’re wielding. Abilities have level restrictions, but majority of them are under level 70.[/quote]
Hmm okay thanks :). Hate to admit this but I think I might end up with a new game to play x.x

Read full topic

item.title: Worth buying membership for?
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:6, topic:531774”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=650559.msg4367397#msg4367397 date=1379937621]

I don’t do a lot of combat if I can help it so I can’t speak for that but at least in the general city areas I don’t honestly see a lot of botting these days.

I’d say go for it.

Thanks, I’ll have to look into it more now. Is combat boring or something? I mean all of the skills are kind of a grind but I know they added a bunch of ways to skill now so it seems easier/less monotonous for at least some skills. I haven’t really played since the release of EoC so I am not really used to anything but like FM, which I am at like 98 lol
[/quote]EOC combat “can” be fun you just have to get used to it and on a daily routine if that makes sense.[/quote]
It is a lot less boring than the old combat system imo. You actually have to pay attention and use the abilities that are available to you based on what combat style you’re using and what type of weapon you’re wielding. Abilities have level restrictions, but majority of them are under level 70.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Without judging RS based on its previous revisions, is it worth paying the monthly fee for? Is the community still garbage?
